inclusion.criterion: Biochemical recurrence (BCR) after local treatment with radical curative intent based on PSA values 1: Following Radical Prostatectomy +/- Radiotherapy: a serum PSA increase confirmed by a second PSA measurement higher than the first one with a value of 0.2 ng/mL or more within minimum of one week.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Following primary Radiotherapy: PSA value of 2 ng/ml above the nadir.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: A continued rise in PSA level despite treatment with curative intent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with negative, inconclusive or oligometastatic disease on the Routine Imaging Workup and susceptible to be treated with curative radical intent (salvage treatment).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Routing Imaging Workup exams are accepted when performed within 1 month before PSMA-PET/CT (this includes WB-MRI, prostatic/pelvic MRI, and/or Bone Scintigraphy).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient treatment strategy based on routine diagnostic work-up needs to be recorded after discussion at the Urologic Tumor Board and available before the PSMA PET/CT.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Signed informed consent prior to any study related procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Previous treatment with isotopes (Radium, Samarium, Strontium, etc.).
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: All medical conditions that might interfere with the correct performance of imaging scans.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Previous malignancy other than Prostate Cancer (except basocellular or squamous cell skin cancer).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients treated with palliative chemotherapy or new hormonal therapies like Abiraterone/Enzalutamide.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: PSA rise while on active treatment (LHRH-agonist, LHRH-antagonist, anti-androgen, maximal androgen blockade, oestrogen). A minimal time window of 1 month is required.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Medical castration with Testosterone < 50 ng/dl (1.7 nmol/L).
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with a history of acute urinary retention in the past 2 days.
